> 1. Is it a problem that I have 64-bit machine and Windows?
Yes it is a problem. Has anyone gotten Cantera running on a 64-bit  
Windows machine? The Windows binary installer is currently made on a  
32-bit machine.

> 2. If I install old nummaray do I need install numpy for scipy?
No.

> 3. On which platform (matlab, python or maybe c++) Cantera is most
> user friendly code?
Well, that is a matter of opinion.  I prefer using Python over  
MATLAB, but MATLAB does have quite a few useful features.  My basic  
motto is "Use Python or MATLAB if possible, otherwise use C++".

> 4. Do you have some articles about using Cantera in detonation
> (symposiums, conferences)? Could you send me on e-mail
> kamil_sobczak@... ?
Prof. Joe Shepherd here at Caltech has developed a detonation toolkit  
that sits on top of Cantera.  I would recommend contacting him.

>
Best Wishes,
Dave
